verses.verse: Job: There Is No Mediator Then Job answered and said:
“Truly I know it is so, But how can a ((Job 4:17; 15:14-16; Ps. 143:2; Rom. 3:20)) man be ((Hab. 2:4; Rom. 1:17; Gal. 3:11; Heb. 10:38)) righteous before God?
If one wished to contend with Him, He could not answer Him one time out of a thousand.
(Job 36:5) God is wise in heart and mighty in strength. Who has hardened himself against Him and prospered?
He removes the mountains, and they do not know When He overturns them in His anger;
He (Is. 2:19, 21; Hag. 2:6; Heb. 12:26) shakes the earth out of its place, And its (Job 26:11) pillars tremble;
He commands the sun, and it does not rise; He seals off the stars;
(Gen. 1:6; Job 37:18; Ps. 104:2, 3; Is. 40:22) He alone spreads out the heavens, And treads on the waves of the sea;
(Gen. 1:16; Job 38:31; Amos 5:8) He made the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades, And the chambers of the south;
(Job 5:9) He does great things past finding out, Yes, wonders without number.
((Job 23:8, 9; 35:14)) If He goes by me, I do not see Him; If He moves past, I do not perceive Him;
((Is. 45:9; Dan. 4:35; Rom. 9:20)) If He takes away, who can hinder Him? Who can say to Him, ‘What are You doing?’
God will not withdraw His anger, (Job 26:12) The allies of the proud lie prostrate beneath Him.
“How then can I answer Him, And choose my words to reason with Him?
(Job 10:15; 23:1-7) For though I were righteous, I could not answer Him; I would beg mercy of my Judge.
If I called and He answered me, I would not believe that He was listening to my voice.
For He crushes me with a tempest, And multiplies my wounds (Job 2:3) without cause.
He will not allow me to catch my breath, But fills me with bitterness.
If it is a matter of strength, indeed He is strong; And if of justice, who will appoint my day in court?
Though I were righteous, my own mouth would condemn me; Though I were blameless, it would prove me perverse.
“I am blameless, yet I do not know myself; I despise my life.
It is all one thing; Therefore I say, ((Eccl. 9:2, 3); Ezek. 21:3) ‘He destroys the blameless and the wicked.’
If the scourge slays suddenly, He laughs at the plight of the innocent.
The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of its judges. If it is not He, who else could it be?
“Now (Job 7:6, 7) my days are swifter than a runner; They flee away, they see no good.
They pass by like swift ships, (Job 39:29; Hab. 1:8) Like an eagle swooping on its prey.
(Job 7:13) If I say, ‘I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face and wear a smile,’
(Ps. 119:120) I am afraid of all my sufferings; I know that You (Ex. 20:7) will not hold me innocent.
If I am condemned, Why then do I labor in vain?
((Jer. 2:22)) If I wash myself with snow water, And cleanse my hands with soap,
Yet You will plunge me into the pit, And my own clothes will abhor me.
“For (Eccl. 6:10; (Is. 45:9; Jer. 49:19; Rom. 9:20)) He is not a man, as I am, That I may answer Him, And that we should go to court together.
((1 Sam. 2:25); Job 9:19; Is. 1:18) Nor is there any mediator between us, Who may lay his hand on us both.
(Job 13:20, 21; Ps. 39:10) Let Him take His rod away from me, And do not let dread of Him terrify me.
Then I would speak and not fear Him, But it is not so with me.
